$(document).ready(function () {
        var logConsole = function (str) {
            console.log(str);
        };
        if ($('#tabPortlet_268121 .divTabEdit').val() == "True") {
            var isModern = ('True');
            if(isModern.toLowerCase() == "true")
            {
                var tabObj = $('#tabPortlet_268121 ');
                var tabM = $('#ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl12_divTabs').attr('portlet') == 'tab';

                function activate() {
                    $(tabObj).scrollingTabs({                 
                        tabs: [{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl12_divTabs_0","title":"Academic Resources","content":"
ASD's At Home Learning Page




AP Course & Exam Updates from College Board
The College Board has shifted AP exams to be administered at home. These exams will be accessible by computer or smart phone. 



In preparation for the AP exams the College Board is hosting live daily/weekly AP lessons for all students, for FREE. Use the link below to review the schedule for each course. 



Click for the AP Schedule for Live Lessons by Course.






Free Books K-12 

    
Audible.com - A handpicked mix of stories to entertain, engage, and inform young people, ages 0–18. Available for listeners in English, Spanish, German, French, Japanese and Italian: stories.audible.com
    
FREE EBooks: - Download the App
    
Scribd - Read Free



Lehigh Valley Learns 

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl12_divTabs_1","title":"Food Distribution ","content":"
ASD Grab and Go Meal Pickup Information






Food Distribution at Community Organizations

Burger King (all locations) 

Up to two kids meals for every adult meal purchased. 

Must be ordered via the Burger King app or online. 



Catholic Charities

179 Chew Street location (off of 2nd St)

Currently providing to the entire community:

Mondays and Fridays from 12:00-1:30 pm (Prepared food)

Actualmente brinda a toda la comunidad:

Lunes y viernes de 12: 00-1: 30 pm (Comida preparada)

Salvation Army

144 N. 8th St & 344 N. 7th St

Food Bank dates and hours: 3/25 and 4/8 from 10am-12pm on Turner street entrance. Prepared bags/grab-n-go.  Other appointments via phone.

Fechas y horas del Banco de Alimentos: 25 de marzo y 8 de abril de 10 a.m. a 12 p.m. Bolsas preparadas / grab-n-go. Otras citas por teléfono.

Allentown HOPE City Church

314 N 12th St, Allentown, PA 18102

Due to limited resources, our congregation is only able to provide some assistance to a few of the families in the church.

Debido a los recursos limitados, nuestra congregación solo puede brindar asistencia a algunas de las familias de la iglesia.

Greater Valley YMCA

425 S 15th Street, Allentown PA

Continuing to serve youth meals Monday through Friday: Dinner 4-5 PM

Continuar sirviendo comidas para jóvenes de lunes a viernes: cena de 4-5 PM







Second Harvest Food Bank- Banco de Comidas

Find Food link: http://shfblv.org/find-a-food-pantry/



Upper Room Tabernacle 

514 Poplar Street

First Friday of every month, 5:00 - 7:00 PM



Grace Community Foundation

108 North 5th Street 

Food Pantry. Friday 9:00 – 11:00 AM, 3rd & 4th Saturday 9:00 – 11:00 AM



Syrian Arab American Charity Association (SAACA)

606 1/2 North 2nd Street

Food Pantry. Wednesday (closest to the 15th) 10:00 AM – 2:00 PM



Casa Jeanette

705 North 8th Street

Monday-Friday 9:30-11 am. 65 households only and once per month.  Lehigh Valley residents only.



Mosser Village Family Center 

614 South Carlisle Street

(610) 820-4067


By appointment only. Open to all Residents of Allentown. The Center is closed, but those in need of food from the Food Pantry can call Mitzi to make an appointment.







PA 211: Get Connected. Get Help.

PA 211: Conéctate. Consigue ayuda.

We encourage members of our community to call 211 or visit www.pa211east.org if they need help. Pennsylvania 211 East is a free, confidential, non-emergency, 24-hour information and referral service that connects Lehigh, Northampton and Carbon, county residents with the health and human services they need.

Alentamos a los miembros de nuestra comunidad a llamar al 211 o visitar www.pa211east.org  si necesitan ayuda. Pennsylvania 211 Este es un servicio de información y referencia gratuito, confidencial, que no es de emergencia, las 24 horas que conecta a los residentes del condado de Lehigh, Northampton y Carbon con los servicios de salud y humanos que necesitan.

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl12_divTabs_2","title":"Free/ Low Cost Internet","content":"
Several companies are offering complimentary wifi to students during the mandated shutdown.



Service Electric COVID-19 response: "Keep America Connected" pledge - to not terminate service to any residential or small business due to the inability to pay their bill. Waive late fees that residential or small business customers incur because of their economic circumstance related to the coronavirus pandemic. Open its Wi-Fi hotspots to everyone. Additionally, SECTV will offer free 10x5 Internet service for 90 days for new customers during this ongoing national emergency.



RCN Lifeline Internet Program for Students (K-12): First 60 days FREE of 25Mbps RCN Internet includes modem, router and network access maintenance fee.





Comcast COVID-19 response: offers free WiFi for 2 months to low-income families plus all Xfinity hot-spots are free to the public during this time.



Charter Free Internet offer for 2 months and Spectrum Wifi Hotspots will locate free public Wifi locations



AT&T COVID-19 response: offers open hot-spots, unlimited data to existing customers, and $10/month plans to low income families. 



Verizon COVID-19 response: no special offers, but following the FCC agreement.



Sprint COVID-19 response: follows FCC agreement, provides unlimited data to existing customers and, starting Tuesday, March 17 2020, will allow all handsets to enable hot-spots for 60 days at no extra charge.



T-Mobile COVID-19 response: follows FCC agreement, plus unlimited data to existing customers and, coming soon, will allow all handsets to enable hot-spots for 60 days at no extra charge.







Please also note that the FCC has relaxed their gift rules, making it easier for schools and libraries to solicit or accept broadband connections, devices networking equipment or other things of value that could help students and teachers affected by school closures. View the FCC agreement stating that providers will waive late fees, not cutoff service for lack of payment and open hot-spots.





These rules will remain in effect through September 30, 2020.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl12_divTabs_3","title":"Mental Health ","content":"
Child Trends

Ways to Promote Children's Resilience During the COVID-19 Pandemic


National Association of School Psychologists (NASP) 
Helping Children Cope With Changes Resulting From COVID-19





Valley Youth House
COVID-19: Resources for Youth & Families








KidsPeace

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl12_divTabs_4","title":"Physical Health ","content":"
Dental Health
Dental Professionals are currently only providing care/ treatment for Urgent Care / Dental Emergencies. 



So, what does that mean? 

This is what the American Dental Association (ADA) has to say: 

https://www.mouthhealthy.org/en/az-topics/d/dental-emergencies



Dental Care can be provided to your child in a Private Dental office and/or via telehealth methods. For those who seek care in a Private office, or in our communities, such as within Hospital-based Dental Clinics (i.e. Sigal Center- Star Wellness Dental Clinic or LVHN Dental Clinic 17th and Chew St. Allentown or Bethlehem) or in one of their mobile units, please consider the following: 



If your child needs dental care for an urgent issue or dental emergency, please contact: 

• Your child's Private Dentist 

• Your Dental Insurance provider for a participating Dentist if you do not have a private dentist

• Local dental clinic affiliated with Lehigh Valley Health Network - in Allentown or Bethlehem or Star Wellness Dental Clinic Sigal Center in Allentown/ Bethlehem



If a patient on a Mobile Dental Unit, such as LVHN - Miles of Smiles Mobile Unit (484-788-9678) or Star Wellness Mobile Unit- (484-526-2106)- you can call them and they can direct you to care. 



ASD Dental Contact

Beverly Wachtmann, MS RD LDN RDH CSDH PHDHP

PA CSDH

PA PHDHP

484-294-5485







Health Insurance
Do you need Health Insurance for you child?

Please call 610-393-7000

A bilingual representative from the St Luke's medical van is standing by to help you.



¿Necesita seguro médico para sus niños?  

Favor the llamar al 610-393-7000. 

Un representante bilingüe de la unidad móvil del hospital St.Lukas los pueden ayudar.








","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl12_divTabs_5","title":"School Counselors ","content":"Our current closure and stay at home orders due to COVID-19 can feel stressful and worrisome to us all.  We must remember to support each other through this time.  Take the time to connect as a family and check in with how you and your children are coping.  We have provided resources that can aid with stress relief and promote positive connections.  If you are concerned about your child or you are a student who would like to reach out you can contact the following resources listed in the document or contact your guidance counselor directly. 



Vist the At-Home Learning page for SEL resources:

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl12_divTabs_6","title":"Special Education","content":"Beginning Monday, March 30, 2020, the Allentown School District is committed to making a good faith effort to provide continuity of education, planned instruction, appropriate, and reasonable services for students while our schools are closed due to COVID-19. 



During the extended closure, all educational services will be provided via remote methods to protect the health and safety of students and those individuals providing education, specialized instruction, and related services.  The District will provide all instruction, including special education and related services through on-line resources, instruction on digital platforms, and low tech options such as exchange of curriculum-based resources, instructional packets, projects, and written assignments.



If your child has special needs (IEP, 504, gifted), your child’s case manager will be contacting you to discuss various ways in which your child’s services may be delivered that are flexible, meaningful, reasonable, and appropriate.  Special Education Teachers will be collaborating with Regular Education teachers to provide modifications and accommodations for students with IEP's who are receiving Regular Education programming.  



The District understands the challenges presented by the school closure and other current health-related limitations that have been placed on all of us. We also understand the additional role that has been thrust upon families during this time.  The goals of the online program are to continue the academic and social growth of our students and establish a level of normalcy to their education.  



If you have any questions regarding your child’s continuity of education, please contact your child’s case manager so that we can work collaboratively for the benefit of your child.  Teachers will be checking email frequently while having office hours daily.  If an IEP meeting was postponed due to school closure, or you have an upcoming IEP meeting, you will be contacted to schedule a virtual meeting in the very near future.  



Our staff values the education of each child. They are excited to reconnect with your child through these online resources.  Thank you for your continued cooperation as we work to ensure the safety of our students, staff, and communities.  






El Distrito Escolar de Allentown se compromete de buena fe a proveer continuidad en la educación, instrucción planificada, apropiada y servicios razonables para los estudiantes durante el cierre de escuelas debido al COVID-19, a partir del 30 de marzo de 2020.



Durante el cierre prolongado, todos los servicios educativos serán provistos por medio de métodos de aprendizaje a larga distancia, para proteger la salud y la seguridad de las personas que proveen la educación, instrucción especializada y los servicios relacionados. El Distrito proveerá toda la instrucción, incluyendo los servicios de educación especial y servicios relacionados, por medio de recursos en línea, instrucción en plataformas de difusión digital y opciones de tecnología menos avanzada, tales como el intercambio de recursos curriculares, paquetes de material educativo, proyectos y trabajos escritos. 



Si su hijo tiene necesidades especiales (IEP (PEI, por sus siglas en inglés), 504, estudiante dotado y talentoso), el coordinador de los servicios de su hijo se comunicará con usted para discutir las diversas formas mediante las cuales se le pueden ofrecer los servicios en una manera flexible, valiosa, razonable y apropiada. Los maestros de Educación Especial colaborarán con los maestros de Educación Regular para proveer las modificaciones y acomodos a los estudiantes con IEPs, los cuales reciben programación de Educación Regular.



El Distrito entiende los retos que presenta el cierre prolongado de las escuelas y otras limitaciones actuales relacionadas con la salud, que se nos han impuesto. También entendemos el rol adicional que se le ha encomendado a las familias en este momento. Las metas del programa en línea abarcan el continuar desarrollando el crecimiento académico y social de nuestros estudiantes y establecer un nivel de normalidad en su educación. 



Si tiene alguna pregunta relacionada con la continuidad en la educación de su hijo, comuníquese con el coordinador de los servicios de su hijo para trabajar en conjunto por el bienestar de su hijo. Los maestros revisarán sus correos electrónicos frecuentemente, mientras mantienen horas diarias de oficina. Si se pospuso una reunión de IEP debido al cierre prolongado de las escuelas, o si tiene una reunión de IEP próximamente, se comunicarán con usted para calendarizar una reunión virtual en un futuro muy cercano. 



Nuestro personal valora la educación de cada estudiante y está entusiasmado por conectarse nuevamente con su hijo a través de estos recursos en línea. Gracias por su cooperación continua mientras seguimos trabajando para fortalecer la seguridad de nuestros estudiantes, personal y comunidades.

","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl12_divTabs_7","title":"Technology Support","content":"
As we hope to move towards a system of distance learning, ASD recognizes the challenges that some of our families may face when it comes to technology in the home. Please fill out the below survey (one per child enrolled in an ASD school) to let us know what kind of technology access you have in your home by April 8!

https://forms.gle/RtzemDRSYkn5betk9 ","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl12_divTabs_8","title":"Updated SNAP Guidelines as of 4-3-2020","content":"Below provides information on SNAP as it relates to Application, re-certification, Able Bodies Adults without Dependents ruling and Pandemic SNAP or “PSNAP.” I hope this is what you were looking for to include on the Resource call today.

 

Application

• County offices are closed to the public however, state workers are remotely processing applications.

• Statewide customer service center #1.877.395.8930

• Folks can call the customer service number to have paper applications mailed to them, report income changes (if they are already receiving benefits and have lost income) and report demographic changes, e.g., address change

• Folks can also the LIHEAP number at our local assistance office and request a paper application: 215.781.3393. LIHEAP staff are in the local office. 

• If paystubs and/or income documentation and or furlough letter is unavailable to the client, the state is willing to take a self-report. If self-report, clients should explain in the note section of the application. 

• All paperwork verifications have been lifted – the only verification that the CAO is checking is citizenship.

 

Recertification

• Any client who had paperwork due in March and going forward, those deadlines have been pushed back for 6 months, i.e., if you had paperwork due in March, you deadline now is September. There are no interruptions in benefits during this time.

• All paperwork verifications have been lifted – the only verification that the CAO is checking is citizenship.

 

Able Bodied Adults without Dependents

• All work requirements have been lifted; the April 1 deadline has been rescinded.

 

Pandemic SNAP or PSNAP

• This proposal addresses the families with kids who are missing school meals.

• To date, the state has not approved this plan.

                        $('#'+this.id+' .tab-pane').attr('tabindex',0);
                    });
                };

                activate();
            }
        }
